remarks: An absolutely convergent series is convergent.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 28-Apr-2014.)
statement:
abscvgcvg.1 $e |- Z = ( ZZ>= ` M ) $.
abscvgcvg.2 $e |- ( ph -> M e. ZZ ) $.
abscvgcvg.3 $e |- ( ( ph /\ k e. Z ) -> ( F ` k ) = ( abs ` ( G ` k ) ) ) $.
abscvgcvg.4 $e |- ( ( ph /\ k e. Z ) -> ( G ` k ) e. CC ) $.
abscvgcvg.5 $e |- ( ph -> seq M ( + , F ) e. dom ~~> ) $.
abscvgcvg $p |- ( ph -> seq M ( + , G ) e. dom ~~> ) $.
$d F k $.
$d G k $.
$d M k $.
$d Z k $.
$d k ph $.
